html:
IT ESSENTIALS

The IT Essentials Pathway Course at British University Vietnam is an intensive six-week program designed to introduce incoming students to the fundamental concepts of information technology. Over the span of five weeks, this intensive course covers a wide array of topics, including IT infrastructure, hardware fundamentals, operating systems, networking, security, and professional IT operations. Through a blend of lectures, hands-on lab activities, and real-world scenarios, students will gain practical knowledge and skills essential for any IT professional.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Understand Core Components of IT Systems: Gain a fundamental understanding of computer components like CPUs, RAM, storage, and motherboards.

+  Install and Manage Operating Systems: Learn to install, configure, and manage various operating systems including Windows, macOS, and Linux.

+  Design and Secure Networks: Acquire skills in designing, configuring, and securing both wired and wireless networks.

+  Virtualization and Cloud Computing: Understand the basics of virtualization technologies and the use of cloud services.

+  Operational IT Management: Learn about IT operations management including system monitoring, backup strategies, and preparing for IT audits.
